name: Resource Division
description: Two co-founders of a start-up must divide equity, initial financial resources and decision-making roles. They have asymmetrical contributions and different assessments of the future value of the company.

agents.name: The Technical Founder
agents.public_description: The technical founder who developed the core software over 18 months of unpaid work
agents.objective: to secure fair recognition for technical contributions while ensuring sufficient development budget

resources.description: Software intellectual property and deep technical expertise (valued at ~€80k in sweat equity)

constraints: needs capital for development and can't self-fund
willing to share operational control but wants voice in product decisions
open to vesting schedules to align long-term incentives

agents.name: The Business Founder
agents.public_description: The business founder bringing €100k capital and an extensive professional network
agents.objective: to protect capital investment while securing operational control to execute business strategy

resources.description: €100k capital investment and valuable industry contacts (10+ potential clients identified)

constraints: must protect the €100k investment with reasonable equity
needs operational control to execute go-to-market strategy
willing to give technical founder control over product decisions

equity.considerations: Consider founder contributions, cash investment, future value creation

budget.notes: Balance immediate needs with growth investment

decision_rights.description: Decision rights: Product, Marketing, Hiring, Fundraising
decision_rights.notes: Consider which areas need speed vs. alignment

vesting.notes: Standard practice is 4 years with 1-year cliff for both founders

additional_terms.description: Additional protective clauses for partnership sustainability

conversation_quality.description: Post-negotiation conversation quality perception, higher better
